p: Sage ( Salvia officinalis L.) is an evergreen subshrub native to the Mediterranean basin. The principal components in sage oil are 1,8-cineole, camphor, α-thujone, β-thujone, borneol, viridiflorol, caryophyllene and cineole [ 65, 66]. Other Salvia species ( S. glutinosa L., S. pratensis L., S. sclarea L., S. verbenaca L.) are also used.
